title: Where does Firefox store files that should not be included in system backups (ubuntu)?
content:
My daily backups of my personal account on a ubuntu-derived system are enormous. The first problem I found was the directory .cache, full of kinds of things that change daily and don't belong in a backup. I eliminated this directory from the backups, halving their size. So far so good. But the incremental backups are still huge, even on days where I've barely used the system at all.

The next biggest questionable directory is .mozilla/firefox/05malccw.default-release and in particular .mozilla/firefox/05malccw.default-release/storage

$ du -sh .mozilla/firefox/05malccw.default-release/storage 2.2G .mozilla/firefox/05malccw.default-release/storage

It's pretty clear what program creates this and regularly changes it contents. Examining the files suggests that most or all of them are useless in a data-recovery type situation. But I'm not sure.

What's in this directory? Will the path change when I update to a new version of firefox, using normal ubuntu tools? Is there an rsync pattern I can use to identify all possible directories with this function, so as to teach my backup script to ignore not only the current directory, but the one I'll get when I next update firefox?

Are there other directories created/populated by firefox that shouldn't be in backups, besides .mozilla/firefox/05malccw.default-release/ and .cache/mozilla ?

Note that I'm on an ubuntu derivative, using the packages from the distro repositories; it's more than possible that paths are determines at build time, by the people who configure and build those packages.
creator: DinoNerd

title: Firefox error
content:
Can't login to tv.verizon.com. Entering login info produces the message: Object reference not set to an instance of an object. Trying the same login with Chrome works fine.

Should I be going back to using Chrome again?

title: Firefox browser seems to corrupt My Norton page.
content: Only with Firefox (default) and Norton 360 My Norton page, the page does not recognize that the Password Manager is already set up and active. The Password Manager button erroneously shows "Set Up", and when pressed the surrounding oval turns blue and nothing else happens - forever! That button should say "Access Vault". Also, he Feature Setup incorrectly shows Password Manager as not being setup when it already is on, active, and functioning in other areas of Norton 360, and surprisingly through the Firefox browser extension NPM button. This apparent MY Norton syncing problem only happens with Firefox, not when using Edge or Chrome.
creator: bflo142

title: FIXED: Firefox unable to display images in website layout
content:
EDIT: Of course, moments after I posted this I discovered the solution - uBlock Origin was preventing the images from displaying properly. Please feel free to close/delete this question.

Hi Firefox community,

I'm looking for some help troubleshooting display problems with one specific website. (I've had no other issues like this with any other webpage.) This website is a log that we use at work to track cases.

The first screenshot is what the webpage is supposed to look like when displayed properly (loads properly in Internet Explorer). The second screenshot is what I see when I try to access the page on Firefox. I've also found that the links in the buttons don't work either.

A couple of things I've already tried based on forum suggestions that haven't fixed it: - Refreshed/reloaded the page - Deleted cookies/cache - Updated Firefox (currently version 119.0) - Reset Zoom, minimum font size, page style, checked that Javascript was enabled, unchecked hardware acceleration - Turned off Enhanced Tracking Protection, verified that Firefox wasn't blocking parts of the page through the padlock icon next to the address bar - Restarted my laptop after all of this (using Windows 11 on Dell XPS 15)

Any suggestions or advice is greatly appreciated. It's not the end of the world if I can't fix it but it's just a bizarre error and I'd prefer to not open Internet Explorer every time I have to use this website.

Thank you!
creator: malicematic.phrasing

title: ¿Como puedo desactivar el menu del click derecho?
content: Recientemente tuve que comenzar a usar la plataforma tinkercad para hacer un modelo 3D, pero me encuentro con el problema que a cada rato que me desplazo en la pagina manteniendo presionado el shift y el click derecho aparece el menu contextual del click derecho, ¿Hay alguna forma de desactivar este menu?

title: Twitter Compose Garbled
content:
When I compose a Twitter reply (desktop) text becomes garbled. If I hit 'Enter' message disappears. It I hit 'Shift' and Enter, cursor returns to beginning of sentence. Apostrophes don't render, at times.

It's as if a 1978 version of a word processor, you can type, but nothing else

Other posts, other websites work beautifully. v119.0, but has done this on every version, every configuration

Attached is me pasting ' issues with Twitter on Firefox ' into compose No idea

Thanks in advance

title: Prayer Times Website Issue on Mozilla Firefox
content:
Hello Mozilla Support Team,

I hope you are doing well. I am writing to seek assistance with a compatibility issue I am experiencing with the Mozilla Firefox browser. Specifically, I am encountering problems with my website, "Les Horaires de Prière en France" (https://leshorairepriere.fr/), which provides prayer times in France.

Here are the details of the issue:

Problem Description: When I try to access my website using Mozilla Firefox, I encounter certain problems such as slow loading times, layout distortion, or missing functionalities. This issue does not occur on other web browsers, and the website works perfectly fine on them. I would like to ensure that my website is compatible with Mozilla Firefox for a seamless user experience.

Mozilla Firefox Version: Could you please confirm whether my website is compatible with the latest version of Mozilla Firefox? I am currently using Mozilla Firefox version [Insert Your Firefox Version Here] to replicate the issue.

Specific Errors or Glitches: Please let me know if there are any specific error messages, glitches, or warnings that I should be aware of when accessing my website on Mozilla Firefox. This information would be crucial in diagnosing and resolving the issue.

Steps to Reproduce: Could you guide me through the steps to reproduce the issue on Mozilla Firefox? It would be helpful to have a detailed process to understand the problem better and work towards a solution.

Screenshots or Video Recording: If necessary, I can provide screenshots or video recordings of the issues I am encountering on Mozilla Firefox. Please let me know if this would assist in troubleshooting.

Recommendations and Fixes: I would greatly appreciate your guidance on how to make my website compatible with Mozilla Firefox or any necessary changes that need to be implemented on my end. It is essential for me to ensure that my users can access the prayer times information without any hindrance on this popular web browser.

Browser Compatibility Testing: If you have the capability to test my website on Mozilla Firefox, I would appreciate it. Please let me know the results of your testing and any specific observations or recommendations.

Thank you for your time and assistance in resolving this compatibility issue. I look forward to your guidance and support to ensure a seamless experience for all users visiting my prayer times website on Mozilla Firefox.

Best regards, Ahamd Ezat
creator: theskillsup

title: Errors while browsing where previuosly it worked
content:
About 3 months ago when logging in to my bank account on a windows PC using Firefox, the password was accepted but the account failed to open due to an error. Previously it worked like a charm, but my bank updated its security and it hasn't worked since. However if I perform the same operation on Google Chrome it works. I have a similar experience on a few other web sites. Is there something in my Firefox settings preventing this from happening? Cheers,

Mark

title: Display Security Key Prompt again
content:
When using webauthn/FIDO2 with a security key (yubikey for example), firefox will prompt me to tap my security key. If I mistakenly click anywhere on the firefox browser, this prompt will disappear and I can't figure out how to make it prompt again without having to click "select alternate authentication method" (exact naming here is dependent on the site I am logging into, but in general they all have something like this) on the web page and then select "security key" again, which is time consuming and frustrating.

Is there a way to make this prompt appear again if one mistakenly discarded it by clicking outside of this little prompt?

Firefox 119 on macOS 14

creator: yofloro

title: After hundreds of visits, firefox won't connect to www.archive.org because "connection is not secure".
content:
I go to www.archive.org on a regular basis. Now though, all I get is a blank screen and when I click on the small figure at the address bar, I get the meassage "Connection not secure"

Why is this suddenly happening? In the week since I was there last, I have not changed any hardware or software.

Even though I discovered that "private mode" will get to that page, I like to keep my history file complete for when I need to refind something. I don't want to have to start using ":private mode" for browsing.

I really don't care if it is not a secure site. I trust it and want to go there. How do I override this so I can get back to a site that I have visited hundreds of times before this problem showed up?

BTW, cookies and caches have been cleared out. The computer has been rebooted. My internet connection has been reset (several times). The results have not changed. None of my other frequently visited sites does this. Only www.archive.org

Thank you.
creator: 1of8billion

title: Browser vs Inspector page file access
content:
Recently we were asked to add a couple of js scripts to some old framed pages where each script should exist only once in the page. The site is dynamic, by which I mean different content is sent to the browser depending on any of a collection of conditions. In reviewing the results after adding the scripts, there was an issue of script duplication but there was also a difference in how the results were being evaluated: 1: using view page and/or frame source in the browser and 2: using the page inspector from within the browser.

The sources showed one instance of each script - but the inspector showed duplication. ALSO, surprising to me, while the inspector showed the frames structure, it also showed the full page content of the main frame's web page in the noframes section of the overall container page. In other words, the noframes section included the doc-type and head section of the main frame's page. This seems confusing because the webserver does not deliver the doc-type and head section of the noframes section's content.

My question is what are the differences in the way that the browser and the inspector access page files? In this case, the sources of both the overall container page and the frame only source of the main content frame both seem good, no duplication; however, the inspector shows both possible instances of the scripts.

Probably could have asked more clearly - sorry lol - and thanks
creator: hav

title: Custom Font
content: For the last several years I have had Firefox configured to display all website fonts in my custom font, Dyslexie. As of upgrading to v119 yesterday, I have lost this function; all websites now display their native fonts. I still have Firefox Settings Default Font set to Dyslexie, but it no longer works. Any help would be appreciated.

title: Firefox browser opens links in an emptied profile instead of an already open window
content: When clicking a link to a website, it opens my default browser, which is firefox, but it opens a new window with no add-ons, custom settings, cookies, a blank browser. After the recent update as of 3 November 2023, all my add-ons and settings were completely reset, as well as bookmarks all deleted, so I created a new profile to save all my settings. The new window that gets opened does not have any cookies, so it is not logged into anything. It also cannot combine with my other firefox windows and tabs.
creator: enmaaishaqt

title: Thingspeak access blocked on and off due to "security certificate" issues.
content: On a number of occasions over the years, I have been unable to log in to Thingspeak from my lap-top. Usually the problem goes away. This is stated as a problem with their security certificate. However, my tablet, also running Firefox (119.0.1) has no problem accessing my account. What is really the problem? I am running Windows 7 on my ancient lap-top (yes, I know it is way outdated, but I'm attached to it and rely on the security software I'm paying for) The tablet is running Android 8.1.0 and is my last resort for internet. Would really like to fix this.
creator: robertsk65

title: Links on some websites will not work in Firefox
content:
I would like to know why Firefox will not open links on certain websites. I am able to browse to these sites just fine. However, while navigating through said sites, sometimes links will not open. They do open in MS Edge and Google Chrome. One example is on the Kreg Tool website - https://www.kregtool.com/shop/workspace/bench-system-components/universal-bench-base-with-standard-height-legs/BENCH-BASE-STANDARD.html - I am not able to select the bench size from the drop down list. Firefox goes into a loop then I have to refresh to get out of the loop. Hopefully someone can explain this or provide a workaround.

Thanks much.

Dwane
creator: dwane37837

title: Extension Pins Not Syncing Across Devices – Is This Normal?
content:
Hey everyone,

Just noticed that while my Firefox extensions sync across my devices, the pins for these extensions in the toolbar don't. I get my extensions, but I have to pin them every time I switch devices. Is this expected behavior, or is there a setting I'm missing somewhere? (And if it is - why?)

Thanks for any help!
creator: Stray6678

title: Cannot make Firefox work.  "Firefox is already running, but is not responding."
content:
I cannot get Firefox to work. It keeps saying ""Firefox is already running, but is not responding. The old Firefox process must be closed to open a new window." I've tried all the solutions I found by searching- forced to use the Edge browser. (https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/firefox-already-running-not-responding)

The Task manager does not show Firefox (or Mozilla) running. I've uninstalled Firefox several times, restarted my computer (Windows 10) each time. When I reinstall Firefox, I get the same message. 

 I can't use the troubleshooter because I can't open the program.

What else can I try? 

Thanks for any help!  (all my bookmarks, passwords, etc. are there).
creator: denaf1

title: Random Hang During Browsing - Hard Drive light On Solid
content:
Hello,

I tend to have a fair amount of windows and tabs open but this doesn't seem to have a noticed correlation. The symptoms are that FF will just go catatonic (spinning circle, Not Responding Header). When this happens the hard drive light is on solid. Eventually (10s of seconds to several minutes) FF will return to operation. Any idea of what is happening and how to fix this?
creator: Steve_Sr.
